melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਕਹਾ ਭੂਲਿਓ ਰੇ ਝੂਠੇ ਲੋਭ ਲਾਗ ॥

translation.text: Why do you wander lost, O mortal, attached to falsehood and greed?

transliteration.text: kahā bhūliō rē jhūthē lōbh lāg .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. There are feelings of hope and expectation of a new beginning and the start of a new cycle. However, these emotions are not dependent on the physical change of the season, but are an encouragement of an internal effort to change.

author.author: Guru Tegh Bahadur
author.description:
Guru Tegh Bahadur [1621 - 1675] was the ninth Guru of the Sikhs, and the son of sixth Guru, Guru Hargobind Sahib. The Guru travelled extensively in the Punjab and in other parts of the country to spread the teachings of Guru Nanak.

The ruler at the time was the Moghul Emperor Aurangzeb who was forcing the Hindus to accept Islam. Some of these Hindus went to visit the Guru and ask for his help.

Guru Tegh Bahadur decided to give up his life to protect the right of all people to practice whatever religion they choose. After his martyrdom, his son, Gobind, succeeded him as the tenth and final Sikh Guru.

text: ਕਛੁ ਬਿਗਰਿਓ ਨਾਹਿਨ ਅਜਹੁ ਜਾਗ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Nothing has been lost yet - there is still time to wake up! ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: kash bigariō nāhin ajah jāg .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. text: ਸਮ ਸੁਪਨੈ ਕੈ ਇਹੁ ਜਗੁ ਜਾਨੁ ॥

translation.text: You must realize that this world is nothing more than a dream.

transliteration.text: sam supanai kai ih jag jān .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. translation.text: In an instant, it shall perish; know this as true. ||1||

translation.text: The Lord constantly abides with you.

translation.text: Night and day, vibrate and meditate on Him, O my friend. ||2||

text: ਕਹੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਗੁਨ ਤਾ ਕੇ ਗਾਇ ॥੩॥੫॥

transliteration.text: kah nānak gun tā kē gāi .3.5.
